caption: First thing to know is that this restaurant is pricy and the portions are small, like other upscale restaurants. You'll need an appetizer and a side along with the entrée. I recommend the potato fingerlings, very very good! That being said, …
Spectacular! Best grouper we have ever had.  Truly sublime.  Everything else was right on par as well.
We for our anniversary,  it was not at whst I was expecting the food was cold and and you don't get much at all.
The best kept secret in Charleston
Elegant space, wonderful fine dining in Charleston. Good parking nearby. Great food and service. Close to the water front park for a stroll after your meal or while you wait for a table.

An underdressed pile of arugula on the beet salad, and my complaint to my waiter about it, led to a very rude interaction with the manager, who came to the table to question me after the waiter had already offered me a new salad, and said, …
Excellent service but they serve boring food with no taste. I ordered chef's special scallop gambo ($40) but, I ended getting boiled food with no flavor what so ever!

We’ve been here many times, and they started out amazing. But the last two times it has went down hill. Poor service, completely burnt pork chop, out of wines, and burrata with no tomatoes. Hey, if tomatoes aren’t in season, then take it …

We were duped. My husband and I were from out of town and planned a trip to celebrate NYE in Charleston. We’re big foodies and spend a lot of time researching restaurants before we travel. We booked Revival because we read it was the number …
We visited this establishment last night.  Everything was good.... but not great.  We had small rack of lamb and halibut.  Service was somewhat slow.

My husband found this spot on our first night in Charleston after many restaurants would not take us for not having a reservation. I am SO happy we found this spot! Beautiful restaurant attached to a nice hotel, great location with a …
This restaurant is the best in charleston,  the fish is fresh and the ingredients are fine quality. The waiter lady is A++, very nice,  for my opinion is the best in Charleston  city

Took my wife out for our anniversary on Saturday and was a little disappointed with the overall experience.   Our crab cakes were delicious, the chicken was okay, but the duck was overcooked and lacked flavor.  We waited for almost an hour …

We had such a good experience here! Our server Dylan was perfectly attentive and unassuming, really allowed us to enjoy our meal. The swordfish and grouper were perfectly cooked and accompanied by seasonal produce. Don't skip out on the …

We had dinner at Revival on our last night in Charleston. We couldn't be happier with our experience. The food was excellent, the presentation was impeccable, and our server, Nick, was knowledgeable, personable and unpretentious. Most restaurants can provide an enjoyable dining experience, but our trip to Revival was actually fun.
Great service food was delicious.
Food was amazing and service top notch!!

Excellent service, a new take on southern dishes. In a party of six not one of us was disappointed, and all believed this was one of our best dining experiences in Charleston. Will return if the opportunity arises

Do you have a question? Recently went to your establishment on Thursday 10/15 and won’t be back! It was very warm in your restaurant at 6:30 as we ask if the air if could be set down . A tall gentleman dressed in black approach our table …

The absolute best place we have been in Charleston, hands down.  The service was impeccable (Nick was amazing).  The prosciutto and pickled peaches was surprisingly spectacular.  Their take on shrimp and grits was absolutely phenomenal.  It …
Best roof top view in the city. Strong service and flavorful appetizers.

Came here last summer, pre-COVID. Loved it. The food was scrumptious and artfully presented. Atmosphere was classy and elegant, service was top-notch. I'm still relishing in fond memories of our experience here!
Wow what a great place
Great food in a cool atmosphere
phenominal experience  great food is an understatement.  service great and atmosphere 👌  highly highly recommend

We enjoyed the food and the service was great, felt very safe re covid in terms of distancing / cleaning We ordered one main and they pre split it for us without requesting which was a lovely touch. My first she crab soup and I really enjoyed!
We had a wonderful evening here. The food was absolutely amazing and the service was just as good! Great job!
The food and the service were exceptional!! Melissa was our waitress and she was extremely personable and also great with our 4 year old.  We will definitely be back!!
Great place for great food.
Excellent food and service!
Lovely restaurant and fantastic service! Food and drinks we’re delicious.

We visited Revival during a trip to Charleston “ before Covid -19”. I was so thrilled to see they are back at it. Revival was absolutely, hands down the best meal I had during our 5 days in Charleston. And there is definitely some stiff …

This is actually a review of the hotel bar right next to this because I think they have a lot of the same bartenders and similar drinks. This bar isn’t on the map but it’s in the lobby of the Vendue hotel and it’s really really good. I …

My wife and I enjoyed a wonderful dinner here. Our server Melissa was awesome. The cocktails were incredible and the food tasted exquisite. My only criticism is that the entree portion sizes were on the small size. Definitely worth checking out.

Elegant decor. Our food selections were well prepared and delicious, a modern take on low country dishes. Attentive service,  thank you CT. Would have been  perfect with blue cheese olives for my martini. The entertainment was interesting …
Poor service.

Fantastic meal during restaurant week. As anticipated with most Charleston restaurants, service was top-notch. All staff were on point with knowledge and customer service, with a special shoutout to C.T. Highly recommend duck dishes or seafood dishes here. Interesting cocktail selection, including the Butterfly Effect pictured here.

Revival on East Bay Street has some of the most delicious and tasty food in Charleston. They have a lot of my favorite dishes on the menu so it is hard to decide what to order sometimes, but no matter what you choose it is hard to go wrong. …
Food was great for what it was even if it wasn’t my thing and so was the dessert. Melissa is an absolutely fantastic waitress.
Ate here for Christmas Eve to what was ultimately an overpriced meal for the food and service. Cocktails were delicious. Come for drinks but go elsewhere for the food.

I recently visited with 5 friends.  First we enjoyed a few beverages at the bar.  Chris was our bartender that night.  It was clear he loved his job and took great care to provide us with beverages he thought we would enjoy.  He ask about …
Phenomenal.

3.5 stars.  Slightly above Average experience for this family dinner outing.  Most appetizers well presented and tasty.  However, the she crab soup was placed in a large but very shallow dish... which made it cold before the first bite. …

My wife and I had a fabulous dinner at Revival this week. The food is fabulous. The crab cakes may be the best in the city. The Low Country  Pirlou was great. My wife's diet restricted her to Chicken which was also awesome. The prices at the restaurant are more than reasonable and the service is exceptional.  Five stars all the way.
This place is excellent. Don’t hesitate if you enjoy southern food served in a refined, French style. Shrimp and Grits in the pic.
Wonderful food, classic environment, and even better service! Thank you Johnathan!
I absolutely loved this restaurant! Karis did a fantastic job serving us and the food was incredible. The atmosphere is inviting and relaxing.
Food was great.  Service was great.  Very reasonable wine list.  Could not have been better.
Enjoyed the experience.

Expensive and smaller portions, but delicious food, nice atmosphere, and friendly staff. The shrimp and grits is a unique and very tasty take on the classic dish, and the duck was also quite nice. They also make a solid dessert. A good spot for a nice night out, but definitely not cheap
What an amazing experience. Very personal service including thoughtful recommendations for both drinks and food. The Low Country Pirlou was fantastic!
Great food and service.  Pickled shrimp and watermelon was great.  Our server, Brad was terrific and funny.

Great service from the wait staff..best I've ever experienced. The she crab soup was good, but dinner was very over priced, and the portions were tiny. Our fish was the only food on our plates. Dinner for two with one glass of wine was over $140.
Excellent food and wait staff
Food was excellent but the service was superb.
The food was great.  The service awesome.  Great cocktail selection of unique drinks.  They set the Charleston restaurant week standards pretty high.

Enjoyed a phenomenal dinner here over the weekend. We were incredibly pleased they took reservations and offer complementary valet. Both the service and for were wonderful! The restaurant is perfectly located for a nice evening stroll down the waterfront downtown or a trip up to the rooftop bar for after dinner drinks.

So happy we discovered Revival! Definitely a date night kind of place. A little pricier but you aren’t going to be mad at the portion sizes. If you’re the type that “can get more and for cheaper at Red Lobster,” just go there. (In my …
Tasty food, excellent service, vibe could be better. Its pretty quiet.
A wonderful dinner! Melissa was a fabulous server. We loved every dish. Presentation was beautiful and I especially loved the vegetable crudité!
Our favorite downtown restaurant!
This meal was so good I was happy about it for days afterwards. Highlights: Pirlou Mac and cheese Corn side Veggie amouse Bouche  Skip the burrata
Great food and great service. Thank you Brian for such a great experience.

Great service with unbelievably creative menu offerings. Most places bring out bread to begin the dinner, not Revival. They brought out a bevy of vegetables for dipping. Very nice and light to start. Definitely a seafood restaurant with a …

Just left here from dinner & it was an amazing experience. I ordered the pan seared grouper and my fiance had the yellowfin tuna; the food was amazing from start to finish. Our server, John P., gave us great conversation and equally superb …

Revival has Welcoming Service! Delicious Oysters, Amazing Food! & a Great Wine Selection! They were accommodating  of our dietary restrictions, and Baby. We felt At Home and didn't feel rushed, and had a Wonderful dinner on our family vacation 😄
Wonderful food and service
I have been to several restaurants in Charleston the last few days and Revival is easily at the top of the list.
Jessica was our server. She was personable and helpful and attentive. Everything about our experience at Revival - the atmosphere, the meal ,and the service - was excellent! A very enjoyable evening!
Food was delicious,  kitchen very slow It took 1.5 hrs for entrees to arrive. 50 minutes for apps. Service very friendly.

We are currently sitting at the restaurant.  Had a reservation at 8:00pm on a Saturday.  Ordered appetizers and food at the same time.  It’s now 9:31pm and we have just received our apps.  Still waiting for our main course.  The waiter and …

Came here for a birthday dinner and unfortunately had a very poor experience and ended up leaving.  Poor and slow service with subpar food that is definitely overpriced. Received a complimentary vegetable crudité which contained some wilted …

My first 1 star ever. The food was terrible. Service scant in a mostly empty room. Price inexplicably high. We got the quail which tasted odd at best and the crab soup which had enough salt to instantly give you high blood pressure. After …

First, I'll say the food and the waitstaff were great.  Melissa was attentive and very apologetic for the service from the kitchen.   We waited over an hour for our entrees which did arrive hot and delicious, but the wait was excessive.
Our dinner at Revival Restaurant was an  excellent experience the food was wonderful, the ambiance beautiful and our service given by Kirsten was exemplary.

The drinks and staff were great and both deserve proper credit. However, the prices match the rent space and not the quality of the food. Mistakes happen and people have off nights, but with only four tables seated, it was very …

Atmosphere:  A perfect dichotomy between low-country history and modern classic.  Neutral colors and exposed brick with a low volume that allows for good communication.  Bathroom was clean.  Service:  Staff was polite and friendly.  I …
Hands down best food and service!!
The best dining experience in Charleston! The service provided by all was exemplary! Our server,  Mattie, went above and beyond to accommodate dietary needs!

Our meal was superb and creative! The chef made a genuine effort to incorporate local food in interesting dishes to provide a memorable meal. The service was outstanding without being too overly attentive. Our group truly enjoyed our dining …

I'm being generous by giving 3 stars overall. The Shecrab Soup was delicious. The Lowcountry Pirlou was very poor, served cold with a bland taste.  The Flounder Imperial was ok but not served hot, just mildly warm. The Crumb Fried Seafood was very good. Overall definitely overpriced!
Great atmosphere. Staff is very helpful guides for the area and will go out of their way to get stock from the back.
The quail is by far the best meal I have ever eaten! Great atmosphere and service. This restaurant is truly special.

The dinner we recently had at Revival is truly one of the best meals EVER!!  The She Crab Soup is by far the best we have ever had.  From here on the meal only got better.  From the Lump Crab Cakes to the Oysters Rockefeller I cannot say …
Service was exceptional. Food not so much.
Service was excellent. Beautiful place. Dishes were great

Our first trip to Charleston and we depended on yelp to help us where to go...and our first choice was packed so we went to our  second choice...Revival.  We liked the look of the menu, and although there were only 34 ratings they were 4.5 …

9.27.18 this was a girls trip of 6. First impression was sub par. Valet guy wasn't available to take our car, the waitress was unkept. But the Food was amazing . We all enjoyed our meals. Scallops delicious, duck very flavorful,  filet cooked perfect, and salad was also delicious...:-)
Best meal I've had all year
Awful experience. Currently sitting at the table which we sat down at 8:30... it’s been 2 hours and still have not got the food.
Can't wait to go back and try more of the various plates.  Food and drinks were both great, and the staff was friendly and professional
Fabulous food and great service.  One of the best places I've ever been to.

This is the best food in Charleston in my opinion. Most authentic shrimp and grits, elegant setting, yet unpretentious service. Make your reservation TODAY!  Absolutely must have a crafted cocktail!  The Revival Julip is exceptional!  Be careful though, it drinks like iced tea!

Had an incredible dining experience at Revival ... great food, great ambiance and great service. I ordered as my entry Edisto Motel Fried Seafood Platter, which was just as I remembered it from years ago when the restaurant in the Edisto …

Thank y’all for making our 20th Wedding Anniversary night so special, the food and desserts were delicious! For appetizers we had the crab cakes. Dinner, I had the Flounder Imperial and hubby had the Grilled Swordfish absolutely perfect! …
Everything from start to finish was perfecto. I was literally blown away, I don’t think you can go wrong ordering here!

Where do I begin? The whole experience was amazing! The food, the service (John), the Manager (Pietro), the Chef(Forrest)... I can't say enough about everyone and everything they brought out as a sample. Truly a culinary experience. We live in Mt Pleasant and have 3 couples lined up to dine with us at this extraordinary establishment.

Revival is everything you could hope for in fine dining. The youth of this newer establishment is not apparent as the waiting staff, kitchen and hosting staff work with the competency of veterans. Very pleased
Two words... CRAB CAKES! Seriously the best I've ever tasted.

I was really impressed with this restaurant. My wife picked it because it was new and near Waterfront Park. The food was great and I highly recommend the Shrimp and Grits. We will definitely go back when we return to Charleston.
One of the best meals I have eaten! The decor was beautiful. The waitstaff were knowledgeable and the service was top notch. Definitely will be back!
Everything was absolutely delicious and our server Maddy couldn’t have been nicer!! So glad that we stepped into this place accidentally!! Perfection!
I had the quail appetiser, the filet, all side dishes and the peach desert over 3 wonderful hours of conversation with friends.

Saw this restaurant when walking down East Bay Street. It's new and the food and atmosphere were fantastic. The crab cakes were so good and the swordfish was the best I've ever had. Definitely will return!
Wonderful experience. Great drink menu. Tuna Crudo and Crabcakes were amazing and everyone enjoyed their entrees. Our waiter, John, did a fantastic job!
